str2: Now, just now, at this moment. Adverb from a derivative of airo through the idea of suspension; just now.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: (primarily physical), I look, see, perceive, discern. A primary verb; to look at.
A riddle, an enigma. From a derivative of ainos; an obscure saying, i.e. obscureness.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
A mirror, looking-glass (made of highly polished metal). From eis and a presumed derivative of optanomai; a mirror.
Then, at that time. From ho and hote; the when, i.e. At the time that.
From pros and ops; the front, i.e. The countenance, aspect, appearance, surface; by implication, presence, person.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.
From pros and ops; the front, i.e. The countenance, aspect, appearance, surface; by implication, presence, person.
Now, just now, at this moment. Adverb from a derivative of airo through the idea of suspension; just now.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary verb; to 'know' in a great variety of applications and with many implications.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
A part, portion, share. From an obsolete but more primary form of meiromai; a division or share.
Then, at that time. From ho and hote; the when, i.e. At the time that.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 1st Person Singular
str2: From epi and ginosko; to know upon some mark, i.e. Recognize; by implication, to become fully acquainted with, to acknowledge.
According to the manner in which, in the degree that, just as, as. From kata and hos; just as, that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 1st Person Singular
str2: From epi and ginosko; to know upon some mark, i.e. Recognize; by implication, to become fully acquainted with, to acknowledge.
